question: 直航
sourceMnemonic: Remember how <ja>直行</ja> is "nonstop"? Well, with <ja>直航</ja> it's the same thing, but it's only used for flights and boat trips, making this a <vocabulary>nonstop flight</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>direct voyage</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
